intro: Tupistra penangensis, commonly known as the Penang spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
